results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: Faith, as well intentioned as it may be, must be built on facts, not fiction--faith in fiction is a damnable false hope.

results.author: Charles Dickens
results.content: Minds, like bodies, will often fall into a pimpled, ill-conditioned state from mere excess of comfort.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: If I find 10,000 ways something won't work, I haven't failed. I am not discouraged, because every wrong attempt discarded is another step forward.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: The doctor of the future will give no medicine, but will interest her or his patients in the care of the human frame, in a proper diet, and in the cause and prevention of disease.

results.author: Charles Dickens
results.content: Reflect on your present blessings, of which every man has many; not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.

results.author: Albert Einstein
results.content: Few people are capable of expressing with equanimity opinions which differ from the prejudices of their social environment. Most people are even incapable of forming such opinions.

results.author: Albert Einstein
results.content: Reading, after a certain age, diverts the mind too much from its creative pursuits. Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.

results.author: Albert Einstein
results.content: Laws alone can not secure freedom of expression; in order that every man present his views without penalty there must be spirit of tolerance in the entire population.

results.author: Albert Einstein
results.content: Gravitation cannot be held responsible for people falling in love. How on earth can you explain in terms of chemistry and physics so important a biological phenomenon as first love? Put your hand on a stove for a minute and it seems like an hour. Sit with that special girl for an hour and it seems like a minute. That's relativity.

results.author: Albert Einstein
results.content: Every day I remind myself that my inner and outer life are based on the labors of other men, living and dead, and that I must exert myself in order to give in the same measure as I have received and am still receiving.

results.author: Albert Einstein
results.content: The ideals which have lighted my way, and time after time have given me new courage to face life cheerfully, have been Kindness, Beauty, and Truth. The trite subjects of human efforts, possessions, outward success, luxury have always seemed to me contemptible.

results.author: Albert Einstein
results.content: My religion consists of a humble admiration of the illimitable superior spirit who reveals himself in the slight details we are able to perceive with our frail and feeble mind.

results.author: Albert Einstein
results.content: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.

results.author: Albert Einstein
results.content: Ethical axioms are found and tested not very differently from the axioms of science. Truth is what stands the test of experience.

results.author: Warren Buffett
results.content: Most people get interested in stocks when everyone else is. The time to get interested is when no one else is. You can't buy what is popular and do well.

results.author: Warren Buffett
results.content: I won't close down a business of subnormal profitability merely to add a fraction of a point to our corporate returns. I also feel it inappropriate for even an exceptionally profitable company to fund an operation once it appears to have unending losses in prospect. Adam Smith would disagree with my first proposition and Karl Marx would disagree with my second; the middle ground is the only position that leaves me comfortable.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: As a water bead on a lotus leaf, as water on a red lily, does not adhere, so the sage does not adhere to the seen, the heard, or the sensed.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: As an elephant in the battlefield withstands arrows shot from bows all around, even so shall I endure abuse.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Should a seeker not find a companion who is better or equal, let them resolutely pursue a solitary course.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Hatred is never appeased by hatred in this world. By non-hatred alone is hatred appeased. This is a law eternal.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Just as a mother would protect her only child with her life, even so let one cultivate a boundless love towards all beings.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: When watching after yourself, you watch after others. When watching after others, you watch after yourself.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Should someone do good, let them do it again and again. They should develop this habit, for the accumulation of goodness brings joy.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: 'As I am, so are these. As are these, so am I.' Drawing the parallel to yourself, neither kill nor get others to kill.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Should you find a wise critic to point out your faults, follow him as you would a guide to hidden treasure.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: 'As I am, so are they; as they are, so am I.' Comparing others with oneself, do not kill nor cause others to kill.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Just as a solid rock is not shaken by the storm, even so the wise are not affected by praise or blame.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Whatever is not yours: let go of it. Your letting go of it will be for your long-term happiness & benefit.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: If a man going down into a river, swollen and swiftly flowing, is carried away by the current — how can he help others across? – The Buddha

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: We will develop and cultivate the liberation of mind by lovingkindness, make it our vehicle, make it our basis, stabilize it, exercise ourselves in it, and fully perfect it.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Should a person do good, let him do it again and again. Let him find pleasure therein, for blissful is the accumulation of good.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: They blame those who remain silent, they blame those who speak much, they blame those who speak in moderation. There is none in the world who is not blamed.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Irrigators channel waters; fletchers straighten arrows; carpenters bend wood; the wise master themselves.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Speak only endearing speech, speech that is welcomed. Speech, when it brings no evil to others, is a pleasant thing.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: The calmed say that what is well-spoken is best; second, that one should say what is right, not unrighteous; third, what's pleasing, not displeasing; fourth, what is true, not false.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Better it is to live one day seeing the rise and fall of things than to live a hundred years without ever seeing the rise and fall of things.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: A noble one produces an abundance of merit by having a compassionate mind towards all living beings.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: He who can curb his wrath as soon as it arises, as a timely antidote will check snake's venom that so quickly spreads, — such a monk gives up the here and the beyond, just as a serpent sheds its worn-out skin.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: To support mother and father, to cherish partner and children, and to be engaged in peaceful occupation — this is the greatest blessing.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: The world is afflicted by death and decay. But the wise do not grieve, having realized the nature of the world.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: All tremble at violence; all fear death. Putting oneself in the place of another, one should not kill nor cause another to kill.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: The thing that is disliked by me is also disliked by others. Since I dislike this thing, how can I inflict it on someone else?

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: One should train in deeds of merit—generosity, a balanced life, developing a loving mind—that yield long-lasting happiness.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world — above, below, and across — unhindered, without ill will, without enmity.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Conquer anger with non-anger. Conquer badness with goodness. Conquer meanness with generosity. Conquer dishonesty with truth.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: 'All conditioned things are impermanent' — when one sees this with wisdom, one turns away from suffering.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Know from the rivers in clefts and in crevices: those in small channels flow noisily, the great flow silent. Whatever's not full makes noise. Whatever is full is quiet.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: Let none find fault with others; let none see the omissions and commissions of others. But let one see one's own acts, done and undone.

results.author: The Buddha
results.content: A mind unruffled by the vagaries of fortune, from sorrow freed, from defilements cleansed, from fear liberated — this is the greatest blessing.

results.author: Hank Aaron
results.content: My motto was always to keep swinging. Whether I was in a slump or feeling badly or having trouble off the field, the only thing to do was keep swinging.

results.author: Harold Geneen
results.content: In the business world, everyone is paid in two coins: cash and experience. Take the experience first; the cash will come later.

results.author: Elon Musk
results.content: If you're trying to create a company, it's like baking a cake. You have to have all the ingredients in the right proportion.

results.author: Ken Venturi
results.content: I don't believe you have to be better than everybody else. I believe you have to be better than you ever thought you could be.

results.author: Jim Bouton
results.content: You spend a good piece of your life gripping a baseball and in the end it turns out that it was the other way around all the time.

results.author: Hugo Black
results.content: When I was 40, my doctor advised me that a man in his 40s shouldn't play tennis. I heeded his advice carefully and could hardly wait until I reached 50 to start again.

results.author: Howard H. Aiken
results.content: Don't worry about people stealing your ideas. If your ideas are any good, you'll have to ram them down people's throats.

results.author: Shaquille O'Neal
results.content: I'm tired of hearing about money, money, money, money, money. I just want to play the game, drink Pepsi, and wear Reebok.

results.author: Olivier Messiaen
results.content: One of the tests of leadership is the ability to recognize a problem before it becomes an emergency.

results.author: Wayne Gretzky
results.content: A good hockey player plays where the puck is. A great hockey player plays where the puck is going to be.

results.author: Thomas Jefferson
results.content: I hope we shall crush in its birth the aristocracy of our monied corporations which dare already to challenge our government to a trial by strength, and bid defiance to the laws of our country.

results.author: Ted Williams
results.content: Baseball is the only field of endeavor where a man can succeed three times out of ten and be considered a good performer.

results.author: Rogers Hornsby
results.content: People ask me what I do in winter when there's no baseball. I'll tell you what I do. I stare out the window and wait for spring.

results.author: George Orwell
results.content: Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war minus the shooting.

results.author: Theodore Isaac Rubin
results.content: Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction that comes after the achievement of a difficult task that demanded our best.

results.author: Bob Feller
results.content: Every day is a new opportunity. You can build on yesterday's success or put its failures behind and start over again. That's the way life is, with a new game every day, and that's the way baseball is.

results.author: Mary Kay Ash
results.content: Everyone has an invisible sign hanging from their neck saying, 'Make me feel important.' Never forget this message when working with people.

results.author: Dan Gable
results.content: Gold medals aren't really made of gold. They're made of sweat, determination, and a hard-to-find alloy called guts.

results.author: Babe Ruth
results.content: The way a team plays as a whole determines its success. You may have the greatest bunch of individual stars in the world, but if they don't play together, the club won't be worth a dime.

results.author: Mia Hamm
results.content: I am building a fire, and everyday I train, I add more fuel. At just the right moment, I light the match.

results.author: Niccolò Machiavelli
results.content: No enterprise is more likely to succeed than one concealed from the enemy until it is ripe for execution.

results.author: Colin Powell
results.content: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.

results.author: Billie Jean King
results.content: Tennis is a perfect combination of violent action taking place in an atmosphere of total tranquillity.

results.author: Pauline Kael
results.content: Where there is a will, there is a way. If there is a chance in a million that you can do something, anything, to keep what you want from ending, do it. Pry the door open or, if need be, wedge your foot in that door and keep it open.

results.author: Ian Botham
results.content: To me, it doesn't matter how good you are. Sport is all about playing and competing. Whatever you do in cricket and in sport, enjoy it, be positive and try to win.

results.author: Jack Welch
results.content: An organization's ability to learn, and translate that learning into action rapidly, is the ultimate competitive advantage.

results.author: Dee Hock
results.content: An organization, no matter how well designed, is only as good as the people who live and work in it.

results.author: Michael Jordan
results.content: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.

results.author: J. Paul Getty
results.content: If you owe the bank $100 that's your problem. If you owe the bank $100 million, that's the bank's problem.

results.author: Jeff Bezos
results.content: A brand for a company is like a reputation for a person. You earn reputation by trying to do hard things well.

results.author: Woodrow Wilson
results.content: Golf is a game in which one endeavors to control a ball with implements ill adapted for the purpose.

results.author: Sam Walton
results.content: There is only one boss. The customer. And he can fire everybody in the company from the chairman on down, simply by spending his money somewhere else.

results.author: Laurence J. Peter
results.content: An economist is an expert who will know tomorrow why the things he predicted yesterday didn't happen today.

results.author: Alan Watts
results.content: I have realized that the past and future are real illusions, that they exist in the present, which is what there is and all there is.

results.author: Abraham Lincoln
results.content: I am not bound to win, but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live by the light that I have. I must stand with anybody that stands right, and stand with him while he is right, and part with him when he goes wrong.

results.author: Abraham Lincoln
results.content: Sir, my concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.

results.author: Abraham Lincoln
results.content: The philosophy of the school room in one generation will be the philosophy of government in the next.

results.author: Winston Churchill
results.content: The inherent vice of capitalism is the unequal sharing of blessings; the inherent virtue of socialism is the equal sharing of miseries.

results.author: Alan Watts
results.content: So then, the relationship of self to other is the complete realization that loving yourself is impossible without loving everything defined as other than yourself.

results.author: Abraham Lincoln
results.content: You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time, but you cannot fool all the people all the time.

results.author: Alan Watts
results.content: But I'll tell you what hermits realize. If you go off into a far, far forest and get very quiet, you'll come to understand that you're connected with everything.

results.author: Winston Churchill
results.content: Now this is not the end. It is not even the beginning of the end. But it is, perhaps, the end of the beginning.

results.author: Abraham Lincoln
results.content: We the people are the rightful masters of both Congress and the courts, not to overthrow the Constitution but to overthrow the men who pervert the Constitution.

results.author: Winston Churchill
results.content: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.

results.author: Winston Churchill
results.content: Courage is rightly esteemed the first of human qualities... because it is the quality which guarantees all others.

results.author: Alan Watts
results.content: Things are as they are. Looking out into it the universe at night, we make no comparisons between right and wrong stars, nor between well and badly arranged constellations.

results.author: Abraham Lincoln
results.content: I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts.

results.author: Winston Churchill
results.content: The truth is incontrovertible. Malice may attack it, ignorance may deride it, but in the end, there it is.

results.author: Alan Watts
results.content: No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.

results.author: Alan Watts
results.content: How is it possible that a being with such sensitive jewels as the eyes, such enchanted musical instruments as the ears, and such fabulous arabesque of nerves as the brain can experience itself anything less than a god.

results.author: Abraham Lincoln
results.content: How many legs does a dog have if you call his tail a leg? Four. Saying that a tail is a leg doesn't make it a leg.

results.author: Alan Watts
results.content: To have faith is to trust yourself to the water. When you swim you don't grab hold of the water, because if you do you will sink and drown. Instead you relax, and float.

results.author: Alan Watts
results.content: You and I are all as much continuous with the physical universe as a wave is continuous with the ocean.

results.author: Alan Watts
results.content: Technology is destructive only in the hands of people who do not realize that they are one and the same process as the universe.

results.author: Neil Gaiman
results.content: The one thing that you have that nobody else has is you. Your voice, your mind, your story, your vision. So write and draw and build and play and dance and live as only you can.

results.author: Eric Hoffer
results.content: In times of change, learners inherit the earth, while the learned find themselves beautifully equipped to deal with a world that no longer exists.

results.author: Larry Page
results.content: If you're changing the world, you're working on important things. You're excited to get up in the morning.
Some people thrive on huge, dramatic change. Some people prefer the slow and steady route. Do what's right for you.
results.author: Julie Morgenstern

results.content: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
results.author: Albert Schweitzer

results.content: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life - think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
results.author: Swami Vivekananda

results.content: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
results.author: Chanakya

results.content: Wisdom ceases to be wisdom when it becomes too proud to weep, too grave to laugh, and too selfish to seek other than itself.
results.author: Kahlil Gibran

results.content: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed. It is the only thing that ever has.
results.author: Margaret Mead

results.content: Life is the only real counselor; wisdom unfiltered through personal experience does not become a part of the moral tissue.
results.author: Edith Wharton

results.content: Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you won't do anything with it.
results.author: M. Scott Peck

results.content: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
results.author: Harriet Tubman

results.content: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him; if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
results.author: Morihei Ueshiba

results.content: I think people who are creative are the luckiest people on earth. I know that there are no shortcuts, but you must keep your faith in something Greater than you and keep doing what you love. Do what you love, and you will find the way to get it out to the world.
results.author: Judy Collins

results.content: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?
results.author: Confucius

results.content: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
results.author: Abraham Lincoln

results.content: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
results.author: Epicurus

results.content: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.
results.author: Elbert Hubbard

results.content: We all grow up. Hopefully, we get wiser. Age brings wisdom, and fatherhood changes one's life completely.
results.author: Frank Abagnale

results.content: Drop by drop is the water pot filled. Likewise, the wise man, gathering it little by little, fills himself with good.
results.author: The Buddha

results.content: It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and happened to things.
results.author: Leonardo da Vinci

results.content: If you have the guts to keep making mistakes, your wisdom and intelligence leap forward with huge momentum.
results.author: Holly Near

results.content: We live in a society bloated with data yet starved for wisdom. We're connected 24/7, yet anxiety, fear, depression and loneliness are at an all-time high. We must course-correct.
results.author: Elizabeth Kapu'uwailani Lindsey

results.content: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.
results.author: William C. Menninger

results.content: Happiness is not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
results.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

results.content: I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best.
results.author: Marilyn Monroe

results.content: The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
results.author: Kahlil Gibran

results.content: That's the risk you take if you change: that people you've been involved with won't like the new you. But other people who do will come along.
results.author: Lisa Alther

results.content: With the realization of one's own potential and self-confidence in one's ability, one can build a better world.
results.author: Dalai Lama

results.content: The trouble with most people is that they think with their hopes or fears or wishes rather than with their minds.
results.author: Will Durant

results.content: Friendship is one of our most treasured relationships, but it isn't codified and celebrated; it's never going to give you a party.
results.author: Hanya Yanagihara

results.content: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.
results.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

results.content: We are either progressing or retrograding all the while. There is no such thing as remaining stationary in this life.
results.author: James Freeman Clarke

results.content: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings, and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.
results.author: François de La Rochefoucauld

results.content: We respect our elders. There is wisdom that comes from experience, and I am not going to stop learning from wise counsel.
results.author: Marcia Fudge

results.content: I'm not in this world to live up to your expectations and you're not in this world to live up to mine.
results.author: Bruce Lee

results.content: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
results.author: Basil of Caesarea

results.content: If facts are the seeds that later produce knowledge and wisdom, then the emotions and the impressions of the senses are the fertile soil in which the seeds must grow.
results.author: Rachel Carson

results.content: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.
results.author: Laurence J. Peter

results.content: One's philosophy is not best expressed in words; it is expressed in the choices one makes... and the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.
results.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

results.content: When you see a good person, think of becoming like him. When you see someone not so good, reflect on your own weak points.
results.author: Confucius

results.content: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
results.author: Henri Nouwen

results.content: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dream, and endeavors to live the life which he had imagines, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
results.author: Henry David Thoreau

results.content: I care not so much what I am to others as what I am to myself. I will be rich by myself, and not by borrowing.
results.author: Michel de Montaigne

results.content: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
results.author: Henry van Dyke Jr.

results.content: In complete darkness we are all the same, it is only our knowledge and wisdom that separates us, don't let your eyes deceive you.
results.author: Janet Jackson

results.content: It is difficult to achieve a spirit of genuine cooperation as long as people remain indifferent to the feelings and happiness of others.
results.author: Dalai Lama
